topic: Emergency Contacts
content: Police: 112, Ambulance: 112, Fire Force: 112. National Emergency Response Centre: 117.

topic: Passport Application
content: To apply for a Sierra Leonean passport, visit the Immigration Department in Freetown or regional offices. Requirements: Birth certificate, National ID, and payment of the prescribed fee. Online application is available at the official immigration portal.

topic: National ID
content: The National Civil Registration Authority (NCRA) is responsible for issuing National ID cards. Registration is mandatory for all citizens and residents.

topic: Feed Salone
content: Feed Salone is the government's flagship agricultural initiative aimed at boosting food production, reducing imports, and ensuring food security for all Sierra Leoneans.

topic: Free Quality Education
content: The Free Quality Education (FQE) program provides tuition-free schooling for government-assisted schools from pre-primary to senior secondary levels. It includes provision of core textbooks and school feeding in some areas.

topic: Business Registration
content: Business registration is handled by the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC) and the Office of the Administrator and Registrar General (OARG). You can register a business online or at their offices.

topic: Tourism
content: Top tourist attractions include Tacugama Chimpanzee Sanctuary, River No. 2 Beach, Bunce Island, and Tiwai Island. The Ministry of Tourism promotes 'Tourism for Development'.

topic: What is the National Cybersecurity Policy of Sierra Leone?
content:
What is the National Cybersecurity Policy of Sierra Leone?
The National Cybersecurity Policy 2021 is the Government of Sierra Leone‚Äôs official framework for addressing cyber threats and securing national digital infrastructure. It guides legal, technical, organisational, capacity-building, and cooperation measures needed to protect citizens, institutions, and the digital economy.

topic: Why is cybersecurity important for Sierra Leone?
content:
Why is cybersecurity important for Sierra Leone?
Cybersecurity is essential to protect citizens, institutions, and national digital infrastructure from cyberattacks that may disrupt the digital transformation agenda. Without strong cybersecurity, digital services, economic growth, and citizen safety would be at risk.

topic: What is the vision of Sierra Leone‚Äôs Cybersecurity Policy?
content:
What is the vision of Sierra Leone‚Äôs Cybersecurity Policy?
Sierra Leone‚Äôs vision is to create a credible and secure cyberspace that protects national interests while giving citizens the freedom to safely use the Internet for socio-economic development.

topic: What is the mission of the National Cybersecurity Policy?
content:
What is the mission of the National Cybersecurity Policy?
The mission is to deter cybercrimes, protect critical digital infrastructure, develop national cyber capability, empower citizens for safe digital living, and enhance national and international cyber cooperation.

SECTION 2 ‚Äî POLICY STRUCTURE & PILLARS

topic: What are the five pillars of the National Cybersecurity Policy?
content:
What are the five pillars of the National Cybersecurity Policy?
The Policy is built around five pillars aligned with the ITU Global Cybersecurity Agenda:
Legal Measures
Technical Measures
Organisational Measures
Capacity-Building Measures
Cooperation Measures

topic: What do the Legal Measures include?
content:
What do the Legal Measures include?
Legal measures include reviewing cybercrime legislation, ensuring laws align with regional/international standards, building justice sector capacity, and protecting citizens‚Äô rights to safe and responsible Internet use.

topic: What are the Technical Measures?
content:
What are the Technical Measures?
Technical measures include establishing a national CERT ecosystem, creating a Cybersecurity Risk Management Framework, defining CNII standards, implementing accreditation mechanisms, and introducing Child Online Protection systems.

SECTION 3 ‚Äî NATIONAL INSTITUTIONS & STRUCTURES

topic: What is the National Cybersecurity Advisory Council (NCSC)?
content:
What is the National Cybersecurity Advisory Council (NCSC)?
It is the national advisory board that provides strategic leadership, oversight, and guidance on cybersecurity initiatives in Sierra Leone.

topic: What is the National Cyber Security Technical Working Group (NCTWG)?
content:
What is the National Cyber Security Technical Working Group (NCTWG)?
It is a multi-institutional technical group responsible for operational decisions and implementation of cybersecurity interventions.

topic: What is the National Cyber Security Centre?
content:
What is the National Cyber Security Centre?
It is the central authority responsible for coordinating cybersecurity activities, enforcing standards, protecting Critical National Information Infrastructure (CNII), and managing the national Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT).

SECTION 4 ‚Äî DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION & CITIZEN SAFETY

topic: Why is cyber awareness important for Sierra Leone?
content:
Why is cyber awareness important for Sierra Leone?
Cyber awareness enables citizens to understand online threats and reduces the number of successful cyberattacks. It strengthens national resilience and contributes to continuous operation of digital infrastructure.

topic: How does this policy protect citizens online?
content:
How does this policy protect citizens online?
It protects citizens by promoting cybersecurity education, building national cyber capabilities, guaranteeing safe Internet use, and implementing legal frameworks that safeguard personal data and online rights.

topic: What is Critical National Information Infrastructure (CNII)?
content:
What is Critical National Information Infrastructure (CNII)?
CNII refers to key digital systems and networks essential to national security, public safety, and economic stability. The policy ensures CNII is protected from cyber threats and disruptions.

SECTION 5 ‚Äî COOPERATION & INTERNATIONAL SUPPORT

topic: How does Sierra Leone cooperate internationally on cybersecurity?
content:
How does Sierra Leone cooperate internationally on cybersecurity?
Sierra Leone collaborates with international partners such as ITU, AU, World Bank, and other global cybersecurity organizations. The policy promotes partnerships, information sharing, and alignment with global standards.

topic: Why does Sierra Leone need regional cooperation on cybercrime?
content:
Why does Sierra Leone need regional cooperation on cybercrime?
Cybercrime is cross-border, requiring collaboration with regional bodies and neighbouring countries to ensure efficient detection, reporting, and response to cyber threats.

content:
How will the National Cybersecurity Policy be implemented?
Implementation will be led by the Ministry of Information and Communications through strategies, guidelines, and action plans built on multistakeholder cooperation between government, private sector, academia, and civil society.

content:
How will cybersecurity activities be funded?
Funding will come from government budget allocations, donor agency support, international partners, and potential cybersecurity-related revenues.

content:

The strategy operationalizes the policy through legal frameworks, public awareness initiatives, capability development, infrastructure protection, and strengthened cooperation.
